info.title: BMC Helix AR API
info.description:
Use Action Request System  APIs to develop applications that integrate with Service Management applications. You must know how to write API programs and be familiar with AR System , including the overall architecture. In addition, you should be knowledgeable about the operating system for your environment and have some experience with client/server applications and plug-ins.

Action                                                                    | Reference
--------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------
Understand the REST API and how to use the AR System API for integration. | [When to use API programming]
Use the REST API to integrate forms with an outside application.          | [Integrating AR System forms with a third-party application]
Monitor the API calls between an AR System server and its clients.        | [Monitoring API calls]

### Learning about the REST API

- [Overview]
- [Learning about]
- [Examples to get, update, and delete an entry from a form]
- [Example to retrieve menu details]
- [Example to retrieve field metadata]
- [Example to retrieve an attachment from a form]
- [Example to retrieve an association]
- [Example to merge entries]
- [Example to create an entry on a form]

### Using the REST API

- [Access and authentication]
- [Endpoints]
- [Error handling]
- [General principles]
- [Resources]
- [Syntax and schemes]

[Monitoring API calls]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/monitoring-api-calls-1027569435.html
[Integrating AR System forms with a third-party application]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/integrating-ar-system-forms-with-a-third-party-application-by-using-the-rest-api-1027568861.html
[When to use API programming]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/when-to-use-api-programming-1027568858.html
[Overview]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/overview-of-the-rest-api-1027568866.html

[Examples to get, update, and delete an entry from a form]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/examples-of-using-the-rest-api-to-get-update-and-delete-an-entry-from-a-form-1027568868.html
[Example to retrieve menu details]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/example-of-using-the-rest-api-to-retrieve-menu-details-1027568876.html
[Example to retrieve field metadata]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/example-of-using-the-rest-api-to-retrieve-field-metadata-1027568874.html
[Example to retrieve an attachment from a form]: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/ars213/example-of-using-the-rest-api-to-retrieve-an-attachment-from-a-form-1027568871.html

externalDocs.description: Endpoints for entries on a form
Endpoints for fields on a form

post.description:
# Login
The AR System server performs the normal authentication mechanisms to
validate the credentials. If the credentials are valid, the AR System
server generates a JSON Web Token (JWT). You can attempt a REST API call
if you have a token. A single JWT token is valid for an hour. You can
use a single token across multiple AR System server that are in the same
server group.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Account

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password

parameters.name: authString
parameters.description: Authorization String that can be used as a name for the token.

get.description: Returns the details of all the entries on a form.The default behavior is to internally call Get List Entry With Fields, which does not initiate Get Entry workflow.

parameters.name: formName
parameters.description: The form for which an entry is to be read.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Selects what parts of the JSON document to return (for example: ?fields=entryId1,entryId2).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order in which sorts the results (for example, ?sort=submitDate.desc)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search qualification

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the entry return

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of instances in which limit the result

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expands the related entries (associations).

parameters.name: runfilters
parameters.description: Expands related entries (associations).

post.description: Display-only forms and Join forms do not generate an entry ID when they are created, and the status code 204 is returned. If an entry ID is generated, such as on a regular form, status code 201 with the Location header is returned.

parameters.name: formName
parameters.description: The form for which an entry is to be read.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Expects a Entry. Also, expects one or more attachments. The
actual binary values are passed as attach-fieldname bodyparts

delete.description: Delete an entry from a particular form. You can also use the option FORCE to force delete all the list of entries, for example, ?options=FORCE

parameters.name: formName
parameters.description: The form for which an entry is to be read.

parameters.name: entryId
parameters.description: The entry ID

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Options that are to be used in the query. Values can be one or more of -
**NONE**, **FORCE**, and/or **NOCASCADE**

put.description:
This operation updates an entry or entry attachment on a form.

**Entry Updates**  
There is one part named as entry with Content-Type as application/json and the value is a JSON entry. 

**For Attachments**  
Each part of a multipart entity has a name, a Content-Type and the value.

There are 0 or more parts with names like attach-{fieldName} with any Content-Type and any value. The name is a prefix indicating that it is an attachment binary data, the part after the hyphen is the name of the attachment field. This updates an entry with attachment data.

**RE: IF-Unmodified-Since**  
If the client sends If-Unmodified-Since and the entry is modified since that time, then the entry is not updated and status code 412 is returned.

parameters.name: formName
parameters.description: The form for which an entry is to be read.

parameters.name: entryId
parameters.description: The entry ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Expects a Entry. Also, expects one or more attachments. The
actual binary values are passed as attach-fieldname bodyparts

parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since
parameters.description: If-Unmodified-Since HTTP Date

parameters.name: X-AR-Client-Type
parameters.description: Client Type ID

parameters.name: X-AR-RPC-Queue
parameters.description: RPC queue to which the client calls are routed

parameters.name: X-AR-Timeout
parameters.description: Timeout (in seconds) for REST request

parameters.name: X-AR-TR-Core-Id
parameters.description: The core ID in a trace ID

parameters.name: X-AR-TR-Counter
parameters.description: The counter in a trace ID

parameters.name: X-AR-Trace-Id
parameters.description: The complete trace ID

parameters.name: X-AR-TR-Is-Counter-Locked
parameters.description: The lock counter
